answers.answer: You can google search on the medical term for this - "Toxic neuropathy -- Metronidazole".In a quick search,  it looks to me like once flagyl is discontinued,  she should recover fully although it may not be quick.Best wishes.

question: my daughter was given flagyl for pouchitis, post colorectomy. now she has developed problems with her fingers. they were turning slightly blue at the tips, now they just bother her, and some are cool to the touch. these symptoms are similar to diabetes (she is not).  will she recover from this, or is there some treatment?
title: flagyl recovery
